docs.title: Welcome to Athi's Workshop Wiki 🎮
docs.text: Your ultimate hub for Minecraft plugins, mods, and modpacks, all created by Athlantes. Clear documentation, guides, and reference material — everything in one place.

docs.text:
• 📦 All Plugins

docs.title: 🛠 Features & Highlights
docs.text:
• ✅ Organized & Searchable – Find docs fast using the built-in search.
  • 🌙 Dark Mode Ready – Automatic light/dark toggle for comfortable reading.
  • 📋 Step-by-Step Guides – Each plugin/mod/modpack has detailed tutorials.
  • 🎨 Visual Previews – Screenshots for a polished, professional look.

docs.title: ❤️ About Athlantes
docs.text:
Athi's Workshop is dedicated to crafting unique Minecraft experiences. This wiki is continuously updated with guides, tips, and reference material for all plugins, mods, and modpacks.

Made with ❤️ by Athlantes

docs.title: 🌍 Modpacks
docs.text: Welcome to the Modpacks Directory! Click on any modpack below to go directly to its Overview page.

docs.title: 🛠 Key Building Tools

docs.title: 🎨 Decorative Blocks

docs.text:

  • Useful mini-maps and visual aids.
  • Automation mods for redstone and building.

docs.title: Installation Guide 🖥️
docs.text:
Follow these steps to install Builder's Toolbox:

  1. Download the modpack from CurseForge.
  2. Install Minecraft Launcher or CurseForge Launcher if not installed.
  3. Open the launcher and import the downloaded modpack.
  4. Configure allocated RAM if needed (recommended: 6–8GB for smooth gameplay).
  5. Launch Minecraft and enjoy Builder's Toolbox!

docs.title: Builder's Toolbox Overview 🧰
docs.text: Builder's Toolbox is a Minecraft modpack focused on enhancing building and construction. It includes mods that provide advanced building tools, decorative blocks, and quality-of-life features for creative and survival builders alike.

docs.title: 🎯 Goals
docs.text:
• Make building large and detailed structures faster and easier.
  • Provide useful tools for both creative and survival players.
  • Enhance creativity with decorative mods and advanced mechanics.

Download on CurseForge

docs.title: Installation Guide 🖥️
docs.text:
To install Farmer's Frenzy via the CurseForge Launcher:

  1. Download the CurseForge Launcher:

  2. Visit CurseForge Launcher Download and install the application.

  3. Open the CurseForge Launcher:

  4. Launch the application and log in with your Minecraft account.

  5. Search for Farmer's Frenzy:

  6. In the "Modpacks" tab, type "Farmer's Frenzy" in the search bar.

  7. Install the Modpack:

  8. Click on the modpack and select "Install". The launcher will handle the download and installation process.

  9. Launch the Game:

  10. Once installed, click "Play" to start Minecraft with the Farmer's Frenzy modpack.

  11. Optional: Configure Settings:

  12. Adjust allocated RAM and other settings for optimal performance.

docs.title: Farmer's Frenzy Overview 🌾
docs.text:
Farmer's Frenzy is a Minecraft modpack that transforms the farming experience by introducing:

  • Diverse Crops & Seasons: Cultivate a wide variety of crops with seasonal changes.
  • Animal Husbandry: Raise and breed animals with enhanced mechanics.
  • Automation: Implement systems to streamline farming processes.
  • Homestead Building: Create and customize your dream farmstead.
  • Culinary Delights: Prepare a plethora of dishes with new cooking mods.

Embark on a journey to build, grow, and thrive in a vibrant farming world.

Download on CurseForge

docs.title: v1.0.0 (Aug 21, 2025)
docs.text:
• Initial release.
  • Introduced self-harvesting mechanic.
  • Added knife crafting and cooking system.
  • Implemented health management features.

For detailed updates and discussions, join the Discord Server.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Self-Harvesting Mechanic: Harvest Raw Player Meat by cutting yourself with a knife.
  • Harvest Others: You can harvest other's meat by right-clicking on other players. Both of you needs to be crouched.
  • Fully Customizable: You can configure this mod by using the config generated by the mod.
  • Cooking System: Turn Raw Player Meat into Cooked Player Meat or other food for better hunger restoration.
  • Health Management: Attempting to cut yourself with 3 or fewer hearts results in Nausea.
  • Knife Crafting: Craft knives to perform self-harvesting.
  • Risk vs Reward: Balancing health and hunger adds a strategic element to survival.
  • Custom Effects & Enchantments: You will get custom effects for cutting, and enchantments to prevent this.
  • Bandages: You can cure the effects by using bandages.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Requirements:

  • Minecraft 1.20.1
  • Forge Mod Loader

Steps:

  1. Download the latest version of the mod from CurseForge.
  2. Place the downloaded .jar file into your Minecraft mods folder.
  3. Launch Minecraft with the Forge profile.
  4. Enjoy the new survival mechanics!

Note: Ensure that you have the correct version of Forge installed for compatibility.

docs.title: Eat Yourself! Mod Overview
docs.text:
Eat Yourself! is a darkly humorous survival mod for Minecraft that introduces a unique self-harvesting mechanic. When hunger strikes, players can now cut themselves to harvest food, but it comes with serious consequences.

Planned Updates:

  • New knife types with different effects.
  • Additional recipes and buffs/debuffs.
  • More ways to interact with other survival mechanics and mods.

Created by Athlantes

docs.title: Flint Required
docs.text:
Experience a more authentic start to survival with primitive tools, realistic progression, and meaningful resource gathering.

Flint Required removes hand-punching trees and rebuilds early gameplay around crafting with flint, fibers, and natural materials. Earn every advancement and feel the weight of real survival.

docs.title: 🪨 Primitive Survival Start
docs.text:
• You can’t break logs with bare hands anymore.
  • Gather natural resources and gradually progress.
  • Early gameplay becomes immersive, challenging, and rewarding.

docs.title: 🔧 Flint Toolset
docs.text:
• Smash Flint on Stone to create Flint Shards.
  • Craft tool heads with them and assemble primitive axes, pickaxes, knives, and more.
  • Requires Flint Head + Plant Fiber + Sticks.

docs.title: 🌿 Gathering Reworked
docs.text:
• Plant Fiber drops from grasses (100% with a Flint Knife).
  • Crude Brush turns Gravel into Flint reliably.
  • Saplings can be crafted into Sticks.

docs.title: 🔥 Progress With Purpose
docs.text:
• Stone tools require actual Stone, not cobble.
  • Cook Cobblestone on a Campfire to obtain Stone.
  • Use Stone to craft a primitive Furnace and continue progressing.

Flint Required brings back the struggle, effort, and satisfaction of early survival—without breaking vanilla balance. Are you ready to earn your first tool?

Created by Athlantes https://www.curseforge.com/members/athlantes

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Requirements:

  • Minecraft 1.21.1
  • NeoForge Mod Loader

Steps:

  1. Download the latest version of the mod from CurseForge.
  2. Place the downloaded .jar file into your Minecraft mods folder.
  3. Launch Minecraft with the Forge profile.
  4. Enjoy the new mod!

Note: Ensure that you have the correct version of NeoForge installed for compatibility.

docs.title: Flint Required – Overview
docs.text: Adds a lightweight, lore-friendly flint toolset and small primitive items to expand early-game crafting without unbalancing progression.

docs.title: Welcome to Flint Required
docs.text: Flint Required reimaginate the early game by rethinking some mechanics from vanilla Minecraft. Now, you can't break the wood with bare hands, that's why you will need some Flint Tools. You need to find the required materials if you want to progress further to the game, but it's ok, it's not that hard.

docs.title: New Tools - But not just that
docs.text: Now, if you want to make some tools, you will need to find Flint, Plant Fiber and Sticks. Take the flint, smash it on a rock (RightClick on a Stone Block) and make Flint Shards. Combine the shards in crafting table to create Flint heads, and assemble those with a stick and a plant fiber to make your desired tool.

docs.title: More ways to get basic items
docs.text:
In Flint Required, there are more ways to get your resources. You can get Plant Fiber from Short Grass and Tall Grass. Also, if you break those blocks with a Flint Knife, you have 100% chance of getting the fiber.

The flint can be gather as you know, by breaking Gravel. But you know how annoying is to not get the flint. Now, with Crude Brush you can brush the Gravel into flint. You can make a Crude Brush by combining 3 sticks and a Plant Fiber in crafting.

Sticks was the hardest to get without being able to break trees, but now, that's not that hard. Instead of praying to get a stick when break leaves, now you can pray to get a sapling too. Every sapling is a stick if you put it in Crafting Table.

docs.title: I have Flint Tools. What Now?
docs.text: Do you think of making Stone Tools? Not that fast. Now, stone tools require actually Stone, so you need to cook it. But the furnace is not the same as you know. To make a furnace, you need first to cook 8 pieces of cobblestone on a campfire, to get the necessary stone for that. Then you are free to bake as much stone as your coal can sustain.

docs.title: Why Flint Required?
docs.text:
Minecraft’s early game has always been about survival and creativity, but breaking trees with bare hands and jumping straight into stone tools can feel a little too easy. Flint Required slows the pace just enough to make those first steps memorable again. Every tool you craft feels earned, and every upgrade marks real progress. It’s not harder, it’s more immersive, more primal, and more fun.

Flint Required was created by Athlantes

docs.title: Infernal Farmer
docs.text:
Step into the blazing world of Infernal Farmer, where survival meets fiery innovation!

Infernal Farmer transforms your farming experience into a challenging, creative, and rewarding journey. This mod brings the Nether to your farmland, introducing unique crops, foods, biomes, and mechanics designed to push your survival skills to the limit.

docs.title: 🔥 Explore the Nether Like Never Before
docs.text:
• Soul Fields Biome: Discover a new biome filled with Soul Dirt, perfect for cultivating Nether-specific crops.
  • Hostile & Rewarding Environments: Survive treacherous terrain and reap the rewards of daring farming.

docs.title: 🌱 Exotic Crops & Ingredients
docs.text:
• Grow Ash Pepper, Blazeroot, Cinder Cane, and more..
  • Experiment with unique growth mechanics tailored to Nether-like conditions.
  • Harvest ingredients that can be combined into powerful foods and beverages.

docs.title: 🛠 Innovative Farming Mechanics
docs.text:
• Tilled Lava: Use lava to humidify farmland and unlock new planting opportunities.
  • Nether Seeds: Plant and grow seeds only found in infernal biomes.
  • Advanced Farming Strategies: Master soil types, environmental conditions, and crop interactions to optimize your farm.

docs.title: 🍲 Unique Foods & Drinks
docs.text:
• Craft flavorful and fiery recipes like Cinder Latte and Cinder Syrup-based dishes.
  • Collect Hoglin Meat, Hoglin Meat and other rare ingredients for unique effects and buffs.
  • Expand your culinary possibilities while surviving in hostile environments.

docs.title: ⚔️ Survival & Challenge
docs.text:
• Balance farming with danger: hostile mobs, extreme conditions, and environmental hazards keep every day unpredictable.
  • Progression-focused gameplay encourages exploration, experimentation, and mastery.
  • Perfect for players seeking a survival experience with depth, creativity, and risk.

Infernal Farmer turns ordinary farming into a blazing adventure where danger, strategy, and innovation grow alongside your crops. Are you ready to conquer the Nether and harvest its fiery bounty?

Created by Athlantes

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Requirements:

  • Minecraft 1.20.1
  • Forge Mod Loader

Steps:

  1. Download the latest version of the mod from CurseForge.
  2. Place the downloaded .jar file into your Minecraft mods folder.
  3. Launch Minecraft with the Forge profile.
  4. Enjoy the new mod!

Note: Ensure that you have the correct version of Forge installed for compatibility.

docs.title: Infernal Farmer – Overview
docs.text: Step into the infernal world of farming, where survival meets adventure and danger lurks in every shadow.

docs.title: Welcome to Infernal Farmer
docs.text:
Infernal Farmer reimagines what it means to cultivate and survive in Minecraft. Gone are the ordinary fields and calm pastures—here, the landscape burns with life, and every crop carries the energy of the Nether itself.

This mod is not just about planting and harvesting; it’s about adapting to a world that tests your creativity, strategy, and resilience.

From the moment you set foot in the fiery biomes, you’ll notice that every block, every soil type, and every ingredient has a story. Farming becomes exploration, and exploration becomes survival. Each harvest, each crafted recipe, and each daring trip into dangerous territory brings a sense of accomplishment unlike anything in the Overworld.

docs.title: 🌱 A New Kind of Farming
docs.text:
Infernal Farmer invites you to rethink what farming can be. It’s not just a task—it’s a journey of discovery.

Tip: Experiment with new soils, exotic seeds, and unusual resources to uncover hidden strategies.

Every day in Infernal Farmer is unpredictable. You might discover a hidden patch of rare ingredients, stumble upon mysterious soils, or encounter creatures that challenge your progress. Survival is intertwined with ingenuity, and your farm reflects your mastery of the Nether’s harsh environment.

docs.title: 🔥 Adventure and Atmosphere
docs.text:
Infernal Farmer is about more than mechanics—it’s about immersion.

Did you know? The glowing soils and mysterious vegetation are designed to feel alive, making every trip into the Nether a visual and gameplay experience.

Players are encouraged to immerse themselves fully: explore, experiment, and create in a world that feels alive and reactive. Your farm is your domain, your recipes are your tools, and your ingenuity is your survival.

docs.title: 🎯 Why Play Infernal Farmer?
docs.text:
• Unique farming mechanics in dangerous environments.
  • Creative freedom with new crops, soils, and ingredients.
  • Survival and exploration blended into a cohesive adventure.
  • A fully immersive Nether-inspired experience.

Infernal Farmer was created by Athlantes

Click a plugin to get started with its detailed guides, installation, configuration, and commands.

docs.title: Changelog – Athi's Airdrops 📜
docs.text: ⚠️ Note: If you encounter any problems, you can join our Discord server for help: Join Discord

docs.title: v0.4.0 - Airdrops for Everyone!
docs.text:
• Added multiple airdrops at the same time. Now you can set in config.yml how many airdrops at the same time you want to have on the server.
  • Improved /airdrop spawn command. Now you can specify the loot table for that airdrop if you want. If no loot table is specified, the airdrop will select one randomly.
  • Added /aidrop list command where you can see the active airdrops (admins only).
  • Added /aidrop clear command. Now you can clear any spawned loot table if you want.
  • Added separate loot.yml files for every loot table. Now you will have a loot folder, where you will find 3 .yml loot tables by default.
  • Old loot.yml will be AUTOMATICALLY migrated to the new system. MAKE SURE YOUR loot.yml DOES NOT HAVE ERRORS BEFORE UPDATING.

⚠️ Note: To ensure compatibility with the new updates, it’s recommended to regenerate or edit your config.yml after upgrading to v0.4.0. Check Configuration tab for changes.

docs.title: v0.3.0a - Day 0 Patch (Kinda)
docs.text:
• Fixed the problem with redeemable items from custom plugins.
  • Fixed the minimum online players needed.

docs.title: v0.3.0 - The Integration Update
docs.text:
• Refactored airdrop management to clean up active airdrops before spawning new ones and improve logging clarity.
  • Improved cleanup process by deferring actions for open chests and handling viewer closures.
  • Added support for executing loot item commands with both console and player execution. For usage, check Configuration tab.
  • Added Nexo integration for loot generation and enhanced logging.
  • Added MMOItems support for loot generation.
  • Improved ItemsAdder compatibility for loot handling.
  • Clearer compatibility warnings for MMOItems and ItemsAdder loot setups.

⚠️ Note: To ensure compatibility with the new updates, it’s recommended to regenerate or edit your config.yml and loot.yml after upgrading to v0.3.0. Check Configuration tab for changes.

docs.title: v0.2.0a - Loot.yml Fix
docs.text: • Fixed a bug where loot.yml didn't generate in 0.2.0.

docs.title: v0.2.0 - Command Vouchers
docs.text:
• Command Based Rewards: Now, admins can create custom items that can be right-clicked to summon commands. For usage, check Configuration tab.
  • If compass system is off, when an airdrop is spawned it will show coords instead of block distance.
  • Added toggable animation in Config.yml
  • Added customizable landing speed & height for animation in Config.yml

⚠️ Note: To ensure compatibility with the new updates, it’s recommended to regenerate or edit your config.yml after upgrading to v0.2.0. Check Configuration tab for changes.

docs.title: v0.1.4 - Fixes V2
docs.text:
• Lockdown Hologram no longer visible when lock-airdrop is false.
  • /airdrop reload now reloads loot.yml and stops the airdrop system to ensure proper functionality.
  • Plugin now checks for errors in loot.yml to verify item IDs.
  • Chance system simplified; Min/Max Items removed from config.yml.
  • Min/Max Items now defined per loot table.
  • Solved minimum player online problem for automatic drops.
  • Ghost chests removed on server stop to prevent leftover chests after restart.
  • Fixed ItemsAdder TileState error when closing chests with ItemsAdder active.

docs.title: v0.1.3 - Even More Fixes
docs.text:
• Improved cooldown logic for compass and manual commands.
  • Hologram management optimized for better stability.
  • Loot handling improved for performance and reliability.
  • Airdrop functionality refined for smoother gameplay.
  • Chunk loading and management optimized.
  • Animation and particle effects enhanced.
  • /airdrop command refactored for better tab completion.
  • Messaging system improvements for clarity.

⚠️ Note: To ensure compatibility with the new updates, it’s recommended to regenerate your config.yml after upgrading to v0.1.3 or later.

docs.title: v0.1.2 - Fixes & Animations
docs.text:
• Chest protection: Players can no longer break the chest; all players have a chance to get items.
  • Chunk loading fix: Airdrops spawned in unloaded chunks now load the chunk properly.
  • Airdrop animation: Airdrops spawn in the air with a drop animation (WIP).
  • Enhanced cleanup: Improved process for cleaning up airdrops after the timer ends.

docs.title: v0.1.1 - Config.yml Update
docs.text:
• Config message fix: A message was missing in config.yml.
  • You can either regenerate config.yml or manually add the missing line to the bottom of your config after updating the plugin.

docs.title: Commands – Athi's Airdrops ⌨️
docs.text: Command Description /airdrop start Start automatic airdrop system /airdrop stop Stop automatic airdrop system /airdrop spawn Spawn an airdrop crate manually /airdrop status Check current airdrop status /airdrop reload Reload the plugin configuration (also reloads loot.yml and stops any ongoing airdrop) /airdrop list Show the currently available airdrops /airdrop clear Clear the active airdrops

docs.title: Configuration – Athi's Airdrops ⚙️
docs.text: Athi's Airdrops is fully configurable via config.yml.

docs.title: Automatic Airdrops
docs.text:
• autostart: false — Start automatic airdrops on server launch.
  • spawn_interval_seconds: 240 — Interval between automatic airdrops.
  • time-before-despawn: 120 — Duration airdrop stays in the world.
  • max_concurrent_airdrops: 3 — Maximum number of concurrent airdrops.

docs.title: Location Settings
docs.text:
• world: world — Default world for drops.
  • center_x / center_z: Coordinates for center of drop area.
  • spawn_radius: 1000 — Maximum radius around center for crate spawn.
  • max_location_attempts: 100 — Max attempts to find valid spawn location.
  • min_players_to_spawn: 3 — Minimum players online for airdrop to spawn.

docs.title: Chunk Handling
docs.text:
• spawn_in_loaded_chunks_only: false — Only spawn in loaded chunks.
  • load_generated_chunk_if_unloaded: true — Load chunks if unloaded.

docs.title: Misc Settings
docs.text:
• replace_existing_block: true — Replace blocks where crates land.
  • particle_interval_ticks: 10 — Particle effect refresh rate.

docs.title: Animation options
docs.text:
• enabled: true — true = play drop animation; false = place chest immediately
  • height: 50 — starting height in blocks above target
  • interval_ticks: 2 — task interval in ticks (how often the armorstand teleports)
  • blocks_per_tick: 0.1 — blocks per tick the armorstand descends (speed)

docs.title: Compass Tracking
docs.text:
• enable-compass: true — Enable compass tracking system.
  • compass-cooldown: 10 seconds — Cooldown between compass uses.

docs.title: Lock System
docs.text:
• lock-airdrop: true — Lock crates before looting.
  • time-before-unlock: 30 seconds — Time until crate can be looted.

docs.title: Hologram Settings - Do not touch if you don't know what are you doing
docs.text:
• create_delay_ticks: 2 — Delay before the holograms are created.
  • spawn_retries: 3 — Retries to spawn hologram if fails.
  • retry_delay_ticks: 10 — Delay between retries

docs.title: Loot Tables – Athi's Airdrops 🎁
docs.text:
All loot crates are defined in loot folder. Each loot table has:

  • chance — Probability of this table being selected.
  • min-items / max-items — Number of items spawned.
  • loot — Vanilla items with material, min/max, chance, enchantments.
  • itemsadder_loot — Custom ItemsAdder items, same structure.
  • mmoitems_loot — Custom MMOItems items.
  • nexo_loot — Custom Nexo items.
  • commands — Custom Items that can run commands when right-clicked.

docs.title: Example Loot Tables
docs.text:
• common_lootcrate.yml 

      chance: 0.7  # 70% chance to pick this loot table
  min-items: 1
  max-items: 5
  loot:
    iron_ingot:
      material: IRON_INGOT
      min: 3
      max: 8
      chance: 0.8
  commands:
    creative:
      name: "&eCreative Gamemode"
      material: PAPER
      amount: 1
      console_commands:
        - "gamemode creative %player%"
      chance: 1
      consume_on_use: true
      cooldown_seconds: 60
      lore:
        - "&eGives you Creative!"
        - ""
        - "&7Right Click to redeem"
    starter_bundle:
      name: "&6Starter Bundle"
      material: BUNDLE
      amount: 1
      # Commands to execute as console
      console_commands:
        - "give %player% minecraft:stone 64"
        - "give %player% minecraft:oak_log 32"
      # Commands to execute as player (optional)
      player_commands:
        - "say Hello %player%"
      chance: 0.5
      consume_on_use: true
      cooldown_seconds: 300
      lore:
        - "&7Redeem to receive starter items"

  • uncommon_drop.yml 

      chance: 0.3
  min-items: 1
  max-items: 5
  loot:
    diamond_sword:
      material: DIAMOND_SWORD
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 0.4
      enchantments:
        SHARPNESS: 3
        UNBREAKING: 2
    golden_apple:
      material: GOLDEN_APPLE
      min: 1
      max: 2
      chance: 0.5
  itemsadder_loot:
    banana:
      material: "iasurvival:banana"
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 0.6

  • legendary_drop.yml 

    legendary_drop:
  chance: 0.1  # 10% chance to pick this loot table
  min-items: 1
  max-items: 5
  loot:
    netherite_sword:
      material: NETHERITE_SWORD
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 0.4
  mmoitems_loot:
    long_sword:
      type: SWORD
      id: LONG_SWORD
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 1.0
    blaze_wand:
      type: WAND
      id: BLAZE_WAND
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 0.5
  nexo_loot:
    forest_axe:
      nexo_id: "forest_axe"
      min: 1
      max: 1
      chance: 1.0

docs.title: Features – Athi's Airdrops ⚡
docs.text:
• Customizable loot tables: Define items and drop chances per crate.
  • Multiple Airdrops at the same time Define how many airdrops do you want to spawn.
  • Compass tracking system: Players can locate the nearest crate by right-clicking a compass.
  • Locked crates with timers: Crates remain locked for a configurable duration after landing.
  • Adjustable spawn radius: Control distance from players or specific locations for crate drops.
  • Custom messages: Configure all notifications, announcements, and action bar texts.
  • Manual drops: Trigger airdrops on demand with commands.
  • Lightweight & optimized: Asynchronous handling ensures minimal server impact.
  • Easy configuration: Simple YAML config files allow full control without editing code.
  • ItemsAdder integration: Supports the latest ItemsAdder version for custom items.
  • Nexo Integration: Supports the latest Nexo version for custom items.
  • MMOItems Integration: Supports the latest MMOItems version for custom items.

docs.title: Installation – Athi's Airdrops 🛠️
docs.text:
1. Download the plugin .jar from Spigot.
  2. Place it in your server’s plugins/ folder.
  3. Start the server once to generate the config files (config.yml, loot.yml).
  4. Edit the YAML files to configure airdrops, loot tables, messages, etc.
  5. Restart the server to apply changes.

docs.title: Athi's Airdrops – Overview 🎁
docs.text:
Athi's Airdrops is a custom airdrop system for Minecraft servers. It allows server admins to create custom loot crates, with configurable timers, tracking, and custom items plugins integration.

Key highlights: - Fully customizable loot tables - Compass tracking for nearest crates - Locked crates to encourage PvP battles - Lightweight & optimized for minimal server impact - Manual and automatic drops

🔗 Spigot Page 🔗 Modrinth Page
